JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you have a keen interest in and experience with mechanical and multi-discipline systems and want to be part of the world’s transition towards a greener future?
Then look no further, we have the opportunity for you!

Your position
At Semco Maritime, you will be joining an experienced and highly skilled team in our Renewables Division where we have one of the largest project portfolios within offshore substations worldwide.

Your tasks & responsibilities
As our new Senior Mechanical Engineer, you will primary be involved in greenfield EPCI (Engineering, Procurement, Construction and Installation) contracts for offshore substation projects. This means that you will be working with everything related to the projects, all the way from being responsible for cost, hours and quality for the mechanical systems within a project, to supporting the site during construction and commissioning.
An important part of this position also includes aligning with external and internal stakeholders when creating proposals, technical solutions and carrying out project documentation.

Your tasks will include but are not limited to:
  • Producing and being responsible for design solution, documentation and purchase together with our procurement department
  • Coordination and troubleshooting with the customer, suppliers and project disciplines
  • Facilitating and participating in client workshops and meetings to ensure that scope and technical solutions are aligned with the contract
  • Clarifying client requirements within the tender and the project phase
  • Ensuring the execution and sign-off of factory (FAT) and site (SAT) tests are carried out with customers, according to the overall project plan
  • Participating in concept development and optimization of technical solutions
Your profile
Despite the title of “Mechanical engineer” you will be working with multi-disciplinary systems such as Diesel generator systems, Diesel fuel systems where knowledge and understanding of all discipline areas within these systems is essential – Mechanical, Electrical and Control. Aside from that you believe that success is only achieved through dedicated teamwork.

To succeed in this position, we expect that you:
  • Hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in mechanical engineering, marine engineering or similar
  • Have good EPC project execution skills
  • Have experience with diesel generator systems
  • Preferably have experience from working in the offshore field
Welcome to Semco Maritime 
We offer you an interesting and challenging job in an international organization, where we strive to provide innovative and sustainable solutions globally. You will get the unique opportunity to work in an environment characterized by dedication, passion and ambition. 
 
You may choose between working from our head office in Esbjerg or from our Ballerup office, whatever is the most convenient location for you.
 
We conduct our interviews on an ongoing basis, so if you are interested, you must submit your application as soon as possible via the link on the page. 
If you have any questions, you are welcome to contact Manager for Mechanical Systems, Torben Vestergaard, at +45 79 16 61 50.
 
We look forward to hearing from you!
